publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1537# Mr David Davidson: Physiotherapy Week 2004-That the Parliament commends the work of the Chartered Society of Physiotherapy; welcomes this year's Physiotherapy Week 2004 from 5 to 9 July; recognises the important work done by physiotherapists across Scotland in the treatment of a wide range of injuries and medical conditions, as well as in promoting healthy living, restoring function movement and independence and prevention of injury and illness through activity, information and advice, and further recognises the important role of physiotherapists in communities and in assisting many to be able to continue to live normal and active lives.

S2M-1537# Mr David Davidson: Physiotherapy Week 2004-That the Parliament commends the work of the Chartered Society of Physiotherapy; welcomes this year's Physiotherapy Week 2004 from 5 to 9 July; recognises the important work done by physiotherapists across Scotland in the treatment of a wide range of injuries and medical conditions, as well as in promoting healthy living, restoring function movement and independence and prevention of injury and illness through activity, information and advice, and further recognises the important role of physiotherapists in communities and in assisting many to be able to continue to live normal and active lives. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-1537# Physiotherapy Week 2004 (lodged on 24 June 2004) Phil Gallie*
S2M-1537# Physiotherapy Week 2004 (lodged on 24 June 2004) Mary Scanlon*
S2M-1537# Physiotherapy Week 2004 (lodged on 24 June 2004) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1537# Physiotherapy Week 2004 (lodged on 24 June 2004) Elaine Smith*, Ms Sandra White*, Dennis Canavan*
